subject: Physics
title: Gravity Basics
core_explanation: Gravity is the attractive force between objects with mass. The larger the mass and the closer the objects are, the stronger the pull.

subject: Biology
title: Cells 101
core_explanation: Cells are the smallest structural and functional units of life. They contain organelles that perform specific tasks to keep organisms alive.

subject: Mathematics
title: Linear Equations
core_explanation: A linear equation models the relationship between variables with a straight line. Solving it means finding the value of the unknown that makes both sides equal.

subject: Chemistry
title: States of Matter
core_explanation: Matter exists mainly as solids, liquids, or gases. The state depends on how closely the particles are packed and how much energy they possess.
